intro: Oreinotinus stellatotomentosus, commonly known as the star-tomentose orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and intricate floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine, star-shaped hairs, giving it its common name. The flowers, which are usually pale green or yellowish, are adapted for pollination by specific insect species.
